reviews.review_msg: Karen is such a kind and incredible professor. She is not only super smart, but always willing to help those who need it! Talk to her if you're struggling; she is very accomodating if you communicate with her and show that you're actually trying.
You won't regret taking her courses. Very caring prof who wants you to succeed in her class.

Karen was a great professor, especially for the online format. Really encouraged to go at your own pace, as each module spans two weeks. She responded quickly to emails and bi-weekly announcements were helpful reminders for deadlines (as well as personal touches and well wishes). Super kind and knowledgable.

Karen was an excellent prof! She responded quickly to emails, provided feedback, and ensured that expectations were clear. There is a large research project, but she was very supportive throughout the process.

Karen is such a kind and genuine instructor. You can tell she cares about her students - this course does have a lot of reading (hence being 4 credits), but the course is laid out so it's easy to navigate and assignments are well divided up.

Karen is an amazing professor who genuinely cares about her students. She has clear expectations and is always available when you need clarification or have any questions. I will always take classes with her!

Karen is hands down the best prof I've had at SFU. There is a large research project for this course (50% of your grade) and she was there every step of the way whenever I had questions or concerns. She replies to emails quickly and is very kind and understanding. I can't recommend her highly enough!
She is so kind and nice, not a tough grader, just take her class. 100% recommended.
